get.description: Returns a time series of release health session statistics for projects bound to an organization.
get.operationId: EXPERIMENTAL: Retrieve Release Health Session Statistics

parameters.name: project
parameters.description:
The ID of the projects to filter by.
Use `-1` to include all accessible projects.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: The name of environments to filter by.

parameters.name: field
parameters.description:
The list of fields to query.
The available fields are `sum(session)`, `count_unique(user)`, and the following functions applied to the `session.duration` metric: `avg`, `p50`, `p75`, `p90`, `p95`, `p99` and `max`.
For example, `p99(session.duration)`.

parameters.name: groupBy
parameters.description:
The list of properties to group by.
The available groupBy conditions are `project`, `release`, `environment` and `session.status`.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
A free-form query that is applied as a filter.
An example query could be `release:"1.1.0" or release:"1.2.0"`.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description:
This is the resolution of the time series, given in a `"<number><unit>"` format.
For example `1h` for a one hour resolution. Possible units are `m` for minutes, `h` for hours, `d` for days and `w` for weeks.
The default resolution is `1h` and the minimum resolution is currently restricted to `1h` as well.
Intervals larger than `1d` are not recommended.

parameters.name: statsPeriod
parameters.description:
This defines the range of the time series, in the same format as the `interval`, relative to now.
It defaults to `90d`.

parameters.name: statsPeriodStart
parameters.description: This defines the start of the time series range, in the same format as the `interval`, relative to now.

parameters.name: statsPeriodEnd
parameters.description: This defines the end of the time series range, in the same format as the `interval`, relative to now.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: This defines the start of the time series range as an explicit datetime.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: This defines the end of the time series range as an explicit datetime.
